results.title: Crash Zone: Heroes
results.creator_credit: Ray Boseley, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Kevin Nemeth
results.brief_description:
Marcello feels rejected when Alex dismisses his idea for a video game based on Virgil. Mike too is deflated when he finds that his hero, Stig MaCallister, creator of his favourite comic, is rude and aggressive. Tempted by an offer from Sunijim representative, Brad Kane, Marcello eventually realises Brad is an even bigger scammer than himself.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: It's Only Words
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Anthony Morris
results.brief_description:
A computer virus invades Catalyst and it’s a fight against the clock to save Alex’s game ‘Trillin’ and indeed, the whole of Catalyst. The kids are not at their best as there’s friction between Mike and Bec. Bec believes he should have stood up for her when his friends made racist comments to her. No matter how much Mike apologises, the team is edgy.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: Big Business
results.creator_credit: Ray Boseley, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Max Dann
results.brief_description:
Marcello tries to make money selling Ram’s new invention. Ram, realising Marcello is ripping him off, dissolves the partnership and then sells one of his amazing new game converters to a strange girl, Louise. Unfortunately Louise’s TV blows up and she blames Ram. Will the other kids be able to save Ram before he becomes a meal for Louise’s huge dog, ‘Predator’?
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: Secrets and Lies
results.creator_credit: Pino Amenta, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Philip Dalkin
results.brief_description:
Bec is intrigued and delighted by a ‘Net romance’ she’s pursuing. The boys are sceptical and their worst fears are realised when they find out it’s really Virgil writing love letters to Bec. Pi tries to think of a way to save Bec from the humiliation of finding out she’s romancing a program! How can she do this when her own lies are getting her deeper in trouble herself?
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: Birthday
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Kevin Nemeth
results.brief_description:
Marcello’s unemployed father is acting strangely and Marcello believes he’s cracking up. While Bec has created her own game about gnomes, Marcello becomes convinced his father is going to kill himself. The kids, confused by Pi’s depression, Bec’s game and Marcello’s weirdness, are unsure exactly who is really cracking up.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: The Outsider
results.creator_credit: Stephen Johnson, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Philip Dalkin
results.brief_description:
When Virgil goes missing after confiding in Ram, it’s obvious to the kids that Sunijim has somehow ‘captured’ him. Marcello sees this as a way to redeem himself in Alex’s eyes and, with his friends’ help, infiltrates Sunijim in an attempt to rescue Virgil from Brad Kane. When Marcello gets into difficulties, the team use all their computer skills to save Marcello and Virgil, reuniting the Crash Zone team.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: Identity Crisis
results.creator_credit: Ray Boseley, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Philip Dalkin
results.brief_description:
Testing Alex’s new game, ‘Trillin’, the kids encounter Virgil, who is having an identity crisis. The surprised Alex is worried that Virgil might be a spy for rival company Sunijim. An offended Virgil gets the kids to help him prove he’s not a spy - but Virgil can’t remember who he really is! The kids discover Virgil has actually grown from a program created by Alex.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ray Boseley, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children’s Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Philip Dalkin

results.title: Crash Zone: Leap of Faith
results.creator_credit: Pino Amenta, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel, Kevin Nemeth and Philip Dalkin
results.brief_description:
Leo Moore arrives at Catalyst with a game he’s invented and Alex is very keen to put money into it. Mike smells a rat, and not just because Leo seems to be attracted to Pi. When Mike realises Leo’s stolen the game, he teams up with Pi to save Alex from embarrassment. Brought closer together, Mike and Pi are drawn into a kiss that surprises them both.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: Truth Hurts
results.creator_credit: Ray Boseley, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Shane Brennan
results.brief_description:
Pi and Bec are asked by Alex to design a game to appeal to girls. The game, ‘Boyfriends’ is about the tribulations of teenage romance. The trouble is Bec and Pi have very different ideas about what it means to be a girl. The game is a mess and when Mike tries to use it to bring his separated parents closer, everyone realises they’ve got a lot to learn about emotions and life.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: The Leaving of Liverpool: Part 1
results.creator_credit: Michael Jenkins, Steve Knapman, ABC-TV (Australia), Australian Broadcasting Corporation, BBC and John Alsop
results.brief_description:
Two English children - Lily (Christine Tremarco) and Bert (Kevin Jones) meet at the Star of the Sea orphanage in Liverpool. Lily has been placed there by her impoverished mother who needs to get on her feet financially, her pain at being separated is eased when she meets the spritely and nationalistic Bert. Together with the shy, hearing impaired Wilson (David Kaff), the three children decide to fly the flag for the empire and agree to go to Australia, their heads filled with ideas of forming a unified family in a warmer climate. This first part of the miniseries principally traces the fortunes of Wilson and Bert. Separated from Lily on arrival in Australia, they are taken to a religious rural establishment, St Bedes, where the boys are faced with gruelling manual labour, and a lack of mental stimulation or education. Bert is befriended by Brother O’Neill, while Wilson is subject to bullying.

From 1945, 10,000 children such as Lily and Bert were sent to Australia, under a child migration system which saw the removal of 130,000 youngsters from Britain. The program took place until 1967.

This version of events led to some of the migrants coming forward with their stories of abuse and neglect. Dubbed ‘The Forgotten Australians’, an official apology was made to them by Prime Minister of Australia, Kevin Rudd, in 2009.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Jenkins, Steve Knapman, ABC-TV (Australia), Australian Broadcasting Corporation, BBC and John Alsop

Separated from Lily on arrival in Australia, they are taken to a religious rural establishment, St Bedes, where the boys are faced with gruelling manual labour, and a lack of mental stimulation or education. Bert is befriended by Brother O’Neill, while Wilson is subject to bullying.

From 1945, 10,000 children such as Lily and Bert were sent to Australia, under a child migration system which saw the removal of 130,000 youngsters from Britain. The program took place until 1967.

This version of events led to some of the migrants coming forward with their stories of abuse and neglect. Dubbed ‘The Forgotten Australians’, an official apology was made to them by Prime Minister of Australia, Kevin Rudd, in 2009.
